title.narrative: Myanmar - ACC support to UNICEF WASH Program

description.narrative: The Australian Civilian Corps (ACC) is a whole of government initiative that deploys civilian specialists to countries experiencing or emerging from natural disaster or conflict, specifically to support stabilisation, recovery and development training. Funding under this initiative supports the deployment of an ACC specialists for water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) development to Sittwe in Rakhine State in Myanmar, working with UNICEF, for six months with an option to extend to one year. More than 140,000 people have been displaced by ethnic conflict in Rakhine State. Internally displaced persons (IDPs) are living in 43 makeshift camps with very poor WASH conditions. The WASH Specialist will provide technical advice, coordination and monitoring for water, sanitation and hygiene activities in these camps. The deployment aligns with one of AusAID’s key country program strategy objectives of addressing the needs of people affected by conflict. The total value of this initiative is $0.3
